text:
Greensock is well worth looking at -

<https://greensock.com/>
Thanks Steven. This has an amazing animations, But I am looking for simple effects and easy to use. Can you suggest any other library?
Greensock will do simple animations for you as well.  It’s dead easy to implement.
Sorry neha, I don't really know of any others, not been in the front end web game for a while now!
Wow.js is pretty ease to use and has simple animations (uses animate.css with it)
I second wow.js. It doesn't get much easier.

Hey, I’m new to this. I’ve created a new drag and drop template, and I’m trying to use the grid classes that are in `layout.css` (supposed to be included with every drag and drop template) and nothing is changing when I preview. I’ve tried adding `.container` and `.container-fluid` to module groups. Do i have to include this file now? Just trying to have access to the grid classes. Thanks!
in the right sidebar there is a place to attach stylesheets
I thought layout.css was included and I could just add the classes to my drag and drop template?
you should have basic responsive functionality out of the box.

animate.css + wow.js is perfect for simple animations. highly highly recommend.

For really complicated stuff GreenSock is the way to go for sure.
this would create two columns left occupies 8 columns right occupies 4 columns based on a 12 column grid
I also recommend wow and animate. We use it for all our animations

To add onto <@UD53A9UUR> above, the layout.css is included, you wouldnt need to manually add those classes if you are using the drag and drop. The only time I could see needing to add them manually would be if you were building a custom module that was to be added to the drag and drop and in that module you wanted to use their scaffolding
much better said, sir
Your example above is spot on
aw shucks
Thanks, what about the `.container` class? I thought it would apply a max width/padding like bootstrap does
the convention is using `.page-center`
but you would add that to your own stylesheet
got it. I was under the impression that you add classes to the modules like bootstrap, but it’s just all included in the background? Thanks
you definitely can add classes, but the basic stuff is handled for you
when you said the convention is using `.page-center`, is there somewhere I can find layout/class conventions for building templates?
good question.  I just learned it over time as i built HubSpot sites.  perhaps <@U2H3TT8F2> has a resource?

anybody experiencing issues with the Page Field inside custom modules … trying to display data from 3 posts/pages inside a module using the repeater on the page field, but only 2 of them are pulling the date, nothing or the 3rd or even the 4th instance
i would advise checking this out <https://designers.HubSpot.com/discoverykit>
This should give some insight on the DM and using classes and attaching styles: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/create-edit-and-attach-css-files-to-style-your-site>
also this: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/cos/included-cos-files>
Just found that the class names are predefined in the boilerplate css, that’s where the “conventional classes” come from
good to know!
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/boilerplate-css>
